entries.meaning: Able or likely to adhere via the drying of a viscous substance.
examples: Is this tape sticky enough to stay on that surface?
This is a sticky situation. We could be in this for weeks if we're not careful.

entries.meaning: Of weather, hot and windless and with high humidity, so that people feel sticky from sweating.
examples: The baby was due in December and the hot, sticky August weather was making Jane uncomfortable.

entries.meaning: (finance) Tending to stay the same; resistant to change.

examples: We should make the printing direction sticky so the user doesn't have to keep setting it.

entries.meaning: (computing, of a window) Appearing on all virtual desktops.
(Internet, of threads on a bulletin board) Fixed at the top of the list of topics or threads so as to keep it in view.
(Internet, of a website) Compelling enough to keep visitors from leaving.
examples: A woman has come to me with the complaint that her website is not sticky: 70% of the visits last 30 seconds or less.

entries.meaning: (informal) Resembling or characteristic of a stick.
A sticky note, such as a post-it note.
examples: Her desk is covered with yellow stickies.

entries.meaning: (Internet) A discussion thread fixed at the top of the list of topics or threads so as to keep it in view.
(manufacturing) A small adhesive particle found in wastepaper.

verbs.description: sticky (third-person singular simple present stickies, present participle stickying, simple past and past participle stickied)

entries.meaning: (Internet, bulletin boards, transitive) to fix a thread at the top of the list of topics or threads so as to keep it in view.
